column2: Job role  : Manager / Sr. Manager - Merchandising The role primarily oversee and manage all aspects of the company's jewelry design, merchandising, product images for category assigned. Manage team and cross collaborate with various departments to successfully implement merchandising and design strategies for product development & management of the respective catalogue. You will work closely on creative value creation for design from a brand perspective.   Responsibilities: Product Design: Inspire the design team to experiment + explore ideas & materials Oversee the design team in developing innovative and engaging product designs that meet customer expectations and align with brand aesthetics. Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including marketing and manufacturing, to ensure seamless product development and launch processes. Creative Lead: creative architect for brand values, product design, curation, research, and development. Communicate the story/Idea to - Mktg & VM Work with the Design and Merch team for Hero products.   Merchandising Strategy: lead merchandising team in developing design sub 50K catalogue, product categories. Analyze market trends, customer preferences, and sales data to make informed decisions regarding product selection, and pricing.  Guide & direct team to constantly analyze the catalogue & identify actions Manage the MTO Work to reduce stone inventory (non-moving) New development - managing and building from the ground up, working with business partners to develop expansion. Adhere to timelines for all marketing campaign ideas Work with the HOD for pricing strategy Vendor Relationship Management  Be the Bridge between CL & vendor world Expand & identify new complimenting vendors Lead work assigned to suppliers to develop new products. Supplier Relationship Management: Maintain close relationships with suppliers and vendors to ensure timely delivery, quality control and cost-effectiveness. Conduct regular performance evaluations, address issues or concerns, and drive continuous improvement initiatives. Team management ability       Collaborate: work with cross-functional teams including sales ,training, marketing, finance        and operations to align sourcing, merchandising and design activities with overall business        strategies. Be one of the key players in strategic planning discussions and contribute insights        and expertise to grow the business. Market Research: keep abreast of market trends, competitor activity and innovations in the industry. Conduct market research and analysis to identify new opportunities, emerging product categories, and potential partnerships that can enhance the company's product offering.   Qualifications / Skills:   10 - 15 years of experience in Jewelry Design & Merchandising is a must Bachelor's degree in business, fashion merchandising, design or related field (Master's degree preferred) Demonstrated experience in quality, supplier management, merchandising, and design in retail or fashion environments Knowledge of product development processes, including design, prototyping and manufacturing Proficient in market research and analysis with the ability to identify and capitalise on emerging trends Leadership skills and ability to motivate and develop teams Negotiation skills, communication skills and ability to build relationships Analytical mindset with the ability to interpret data and make informed decisions Strong project management skills and the ability to prioritise and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment Creative thinking and a passion for design and product innovation Preferably a female candidate Job location : Andheri (E), Mumbai

column2: The role requires to manage customer support team and liaise with internal stakeholders across sales, operations, cataloguing, finance and merchandising to enhance consumer experience. Implement processes and technology automations to efficiently scale up the team s capacity in a hypergrowth environment.     Lead the Customer Service Team and set up Processes to improve overall KPIs related to customer service     Plan, strategize and execute the most efficient team structure required to meet KPIs     Project manage improvements on Puma.com site to ensure enhanced consumer experience     Monitor customer satisfaction survey ratings, net promoter score or any other survey/ feedback ratings taken from customers and ensure continuous improvement if below target.Enhance customer experience with technology automations around refunds, chatbots etc.                             YOUR TALENT        Eligibility Criteria and Functional Competencies      Required           MBA/PGDBM from Tier I Business School or equivalent certification and/or Bachelors Degree from a Tier I college (IITs, BITS, NITs)     Minimum 5 years of work experience in Customer support/customer experience with 2+ years managing large teams with operational complexity     Six sigma certifications will be preferred     Experience in eCommerce industry is an advantage     Ability to take ownership and deliver in a fast-paced start-up like environment.     Excellent written and verbal communication skills.     Ability to collaborate across teams and strong interpersonal skills

column2: This role is responsible for maximizing the sales, profitability, and brand equity of eCommerce through the management and execution of:                         Build, enhance, and create merchandise plans for pre-season GTM milestones with on-time forecast to support seasonal Brand, commercial, and regional ambitions alongside priorities within seasonal OTB intake ratios and buying guidelines.                             In-season article reporting and trading to ensure category and product performance meets expectations via a suite of KPIs and tools. Report performance to and coordinate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders to mitigate risk and further drive product opportunities.                           Key Responsibilities:                            Create and lead strategic initiatives and projects with the Director, eCom Merchandising involving overall buy strategy and volumes designed to optimize revenue opportunity for the business.                             Partner with leaders in eCommerce (eCom) Emerging Markets and the Local Country/Cluster buying teams to build, deliver & interpret regular (Daily / weekly / monthly / quarterly / seasonal) category business & trading updates.                             Lead, coach and guide junior eCom merchandisers to provide strategic actions & recommendations based on analysis and trending for current & future buys regarding volume & distribution to maximize sales and profitability.                             Understand the intricacies of and contribute to improvements in launch excellence, replenishment opportunities as well as range enhancements for local markets.                              Proactively improve on the framework for key promotional analysis techniques                              Track, analyze, interpret and provide recommendations based on/for: market benchmarks and KPIs on productivity and sell thru, Improvement of Range Yield/Range Profitability, and other key merchandising KPIs.                             Forecast planning on business unit level, net sales, margin and ASP.                             Detailed category reports- To influence in-season & end of season markdown strategy.                             Product mix according to Country, Season, Target customer, share of categories, gender mix, etc.                             Provide insight and suggestion for eCommerce channels in reconciliation with the Hub Merchandisers & Country/Cluster buying teams.                             Support the enhancement of all product planning systems and tools to suit world class buying practice across SEA.                             Drive eCommerce capacity planning processes for all Emerging Market countries.                             Provide insights and influence integrated business planning.                             Play a key role in the implementation of the Emerging Markets eCom Merchandising Strategy in all activities conducted by the department.                             Work pro-actively, propose changes in processes to continually drive best in class experience for the adidas consumer.                             Other duties as requested by your manager.                           Key Relationships:                            eCom Team                             Supply Chain and Logistics                             Demand Planning/Finance Teams                             Marketing Activations/Campaign Operations                             Emerging Markets Analytics                             Consumer Experience Team                             Country eCom Leads                           Knowledge, Skills and Abilities           :                         Leadership and influencing skills                             Structured, organized and process-orientated                             Ability to work effectively within a team environment and under pressure                             Strong analytical skills                             Attention to detail                             Fluent in English                             Additional language is an advantage                             Advanced user of MS Office suite of products esp. Excel, Access, PPT                             Advanced knowledge of Retail Management Systems SAP AFS, SAP PGR, DBM, Microstrategy                             Dashboarding/Data Visualization experience a plus                             Geographically mobile                           Requisite Education and Experience / Minimum Qualifications:                            University degree, ideally in business with sales and finance focus or equivalent professional experience                             6-8 years experience in merchandising or related functions (incl. buying, planning, distribution, budgeting)                             eCom experience a plus                             2-3 years management experience                             Functional awareness of Operations and Finance                         COURAGE:    Speak up when you see an opportunity; step up when you see a need..           OWNERSHIP:    Pick up the ball. Be proactive, take responsibility and follow-through.           INNOVATION:    Elevate to win. Be curious, test and learn new and better ways of doing things.           TEAMPLAY:    Win together. Work collaboratively and cultivate a shared mindset.           INTEGRITY:    Play by the rules. Hold yourself and others accountable to our company s standards.           RESPECT:    Value all players. Display empathy, be inclusive and show dignity to all.

column2: We are seeking an experienced and strategic Senior Merchandiser to join our dynamic team in the fast-paced world of ecommerce. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in merchandising, product management, and a deep understanding of consumer behavior in the online retail space. The Senior Merchandiser will play a crucial role in driving sales, optimizing product assortments, and enhancing the overall customer experience.               Responsibilities:         Be a part of a jewelry product development process, and ensure that designs align with our brand and resonate with our target audience.     Responsible for coordinating with team incase of new product launches     Stay informed about industry trends, competitor activities, and emerging market opportunities.     Collaborate closely with jewelry designers, offering guidance and feedback to bring your merchandising concepts to life in the most appealing way     Collaborate with marketing, sales, and other cross-functional teams to align merchandising efforts with overall business strategies.     Communicate effectively with internal stakeholders to ensure seamless execution of merchandising plans.         Qualifications:         Bachelor s degree in Business, Marketing, or a related field. Master s degree is a plus.     10+ years of experience in ecommerce merchandising or product management, with a proven track record of driving sales and profitability.     Strong analytical skills and proficiency in using data analytics tools.     Excellent communication and collaboration skills.     Familiarity with ecommerce platforms and technologies.     Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.         ?

column2: Brilliant Earth is seeking a dynamic and experienced Senior Manager to join our Merchandising team and lead the strategic planning and management of inventory across key categories. Reporting directly to the Senior Director of Merchandising, the Senior Manager will play a pivotal role in optimizing inventory levels, driving process improvements, and implementing strategic initiatives to support the companys growth objectives. The Senior Manager will also be fundamental in guiding assortment optimization, utilizing insights from the planning perspective to inform product strategy. They will also generate category reporting and tools to track performance metrics, collaborating closely with cross-functional teams to align inventory management strategies with broader business objectives.         Key Responsibilities:         Merchandise Planning and Allocation: Oversee the development and execution of merchandise planning strategies, including open-to-buy management, allocation optimization, and store planning initiatives.     Assortment Planning: Collaborate with Category Merchandising teams to inform product strategy, SKU count targets, product lifecycle management, and pricing decisions, ensuring alignment with overall merchandising objectives.     Strategic Inventory Management: Lead the development of comprehensive sales and inventory forecasts, overseeing the management of inventory levels to align with company sales targets and objectives.     Team Leadership and Development: Manage and mentor a team of merchandise planners, providing guidance and support to ensure optimal performance and professional growth.     Process Optimization: Drive continuous improvement initiatives, including the development and implementation of new forecasting tools, reporting, processes and procedures to enhance efficiency and effectiveness in inventory planning and allocation.     Cross-Functional Collaboration: Collaborate closely with category merchandising, visual merchandising, operations, and finance teams to provide strategic insights and guidance on inventory-related matters, ensuring alignment with overall business objectives.         Qualifications:         8+ years of experience in merchandise planning, inventory management, or related roles within the retail, product, or e-commerce industry.     Experience with Planning (such as Blue Yonder, Logility, Demantra, MI9, etc.) and Reporting (such as Domo, Tableau, power BI) software is highly desirable.     Proven Leadership Experience: Demonstrated success in leading and developing high-performing teams, with a track record of driving results through effective team management and mentorship.     Strategic Thinker: Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to develop and execute strategic initiatives to drive business growth and operational excellence.     Expertise in Inventory Management: Extensive experience in managing inventory levels, creating new processes, and driving change to optimize in-stock levels and improve inventory performance.     Cross-Functional Collaboration: Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and influence stakeholders at all levels of the organization.     Entrepreneurial Mindset: Self-starter with a proactive and entrepreneurial spirit, able to thrive in a fast-paced, startup environment while maintaining a focus on achieving both business and social goals. Possesses strong problem-solving skills, approaching challenges with a positive and innovative mindset to drive solutions.     Passion for our Mission: Genuine interest in socially and environmentally responsible organizations and products, with a commitment to advancing Brilliant Earths mission of ethical sourcing and sustainability.     Bachelors degree or equivalent in Business Administration, Finance, or related field. Advanced degree or relevant certifications are a plus.     Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications, including Excel, Outlook, and PowerPoint
column11: Merchandise planning, Process optimization, Team management, Operational excellence, Visual Merchandising, Analytical, Strategic planning, Wellness, E-commerce, Forecasting

column2: Position Title:  Assistant Manager - Category (Footwear) Reports to:  Manager Category - Footwear Location:  Bangalore Position Summary: As an Assistant Manager - Category (Footwear) in our Merchandising team, you would be responsible for the Performance and Motorsport Footwear range planning. You would be working closely with the Sales and Channel Merchandising team. Key Objectives: Analyzing seasonal trends and historical data; leveraging the same for range planning and pricing maximizing net sales and gross margins. Responsible for delivering top and bottom-line targets for the category. Organizing road shows and presenting the range to customers. Maximizing efficiency and business from the product lines offered by Puma Global. Working closely with the Channel merchandising and sales team to understand the gaps in the inline range and fulfilling the same through SMU products/lines. Forecasting and uploading the same into the system on time as per Global deadlines. Regular analysis of channel-wise sales and incorporating the same in the current/future season to maximize business. Working closely with Global product teams; Attending Global meetings and reviews; providing Puma India feedback and suggestions; highlighting India specific requirements. Tracking deliveries to meet launches aligned with global in-store dates and seasonal requirements. Collecting market intelligence on competition brands with respect to product, pricing, and distribution channels. Negotiating costs with sourcing team to attain optimum COGS and maximize gross margins. Working closely with Marketing and VM to ensure key stories are highlighted across channels and media. Key Performance Indicators: Driving Net sales COGS Gross Profit for the category Organizational Relationships: Internal: Global BU & GTM Teams Merchandising & Planning Sales, Sales Ops & SCM Sourcing Finance Marketing & Demand External: Customers Sourcing vendors Eligibility Criteria and Functional Competencies Required: PG from NIFT or other fashion management/technology from Tier 1 college. 5-7 years of experience. Well-versed in Microsoft Excel. Strong numerical, analytical, and merchandising skills. Good Product knowledge. Knowledge of other analytical tools will be useful. Ability to multitask and prioritize work based on business importance. Willingness to learn new technology/tools as required by business. Prior knowledge of Retail/e-commerce industry would be important. Great communication and stakeholder management.
column11: Category Management, Footwear Merchandising, Footwear, Sales Strategy, Merchandising

column2: Role & responsibilities       Arranging for Buyer meetings with collection of samples. Getting the consumption from the SAMPLE/CAD Dept for the new enquirers and verifying the same. Arranging fabric, Accessories and trims for new enquirers based on the consumption given by CAD dept. Explaining the enquirer to Sample Dept and arrange for the Proto sample stitching, emb, printing and other value additions. For any clarifications get the approval from buyer or buying agents. Analyzing, Critical examining the sample methods & choosing an appropriate one for easy bulk production. Get the approval for the Proto samples from the buyer. Fixing the delivery dates based on the capacity of supplier and the production units and confirms the same to buyer and PPC Dept. Raising purchase orders with the help of Procurement Dept for Fabric, Accessories & Trims with all the prices, delivery dates and conditions. Negotiating the prices with the supplier to reduce the PP. Harmonizing with All suppliers for timely in housing of fabric with emb/printing, accessories and trims. Follow-up with factory at each stages of production and inform the real situation to buyer and confirming the shipment plans with the buyer. Arrange for the shipping documents such as invoice, packing list, bill of lading, airway bill with the help of Shipping dept and inform the same to buyer. Follow up with buyer for the payment pending. Acknowledging all new enquirers, orders, couriers, clarifications and all the mails from buyer and supplier Responsible for all samples, final inspections and inspectors. Inspection results from internal/external are collected, analyzed and inform to buyer or buying agency, Dealing with Buyers and Buying house etc.   Preferred candidate profile     Should have minimum 5 years experience as a merchandiser in Export Unit of Home Textiles. A good organizer, proactive willing team player having an eye for detail. Should have good command in written and spoken English. Computer literate with excellent command in MS Office applications like Excel is a must. Candidates staying in Gurgaon will be preferred. The person must be well conversant with the functioning of the textile/garments industry and capable of delivering the results to outperform.  Perks and benefits

column2: Working in the capacity of Merchandise Planner to develop competitive & sustainable strategy for profitable growth, create the framework for smooth functioning of the categories to attain maximum merchandising efficiency.       Main Responsibilities       a . Should be executing timely customer demand analysis and market trends study to help decide merchandize buying aligning with company goals and financial budgets agreed with planning team for all categories.   b . Collaborate with the finance department to forecast or determine whether the costs of raw materials will increase or decrease.   c . Convey product ideas to the divisional leaders and the cross-functional team based on category needs.   d . Initiate and manage consumer, market, industry, and competitor research to identify business opportunities while keeping a pulse on existing customers and understanding the needs and expectations of prospective customers within assigned market segments.   e . Partner with key cross-functional partners to ensure category execution is on brand and delivers to business objectives.   f . Work with the sourcing team to build a product that meets customer expectations and satisfies the brand KPIs.   g . Responsible for identifying and working with reliable vendors who can most successfully fulfill product needs at the best price.   h . Review and approve plan to purchase well in advance to address festival, occasions and seasonal needs for all categories while working closely with B&M team.   i . Monitor and regularly reviews performance indicators, such as sales and discount levels by driving plans for stock levels in all categories; reacting to changes in demand and logistics.   j . Assortment Planning for all categories   A. Monitor costs and expenses to assist in budget preparation. OPEX cost controlling.   B. Formulate & Implement strategies for driving efficiency in bottom lines with focus on penalty and cost of operations.   C. Highlighting fast-moving and slow-moving products on a weekly basis.   D. Tracking sales performance for top twenty products of different categories.   E. Vendor evaluation in terms of delivery, quality and sale thru.       Educational Qualifications    Bachelor s degree with MBA in Retail Management / Marketing will be most preferred.       Experience    Atleast Five years of relevant experience in handling various facets of Retail business objectives, business environment and related processes with Retail Planning along with conducting market research, developing retail strategies and liaising with Buying team for providing market intelligence feedback & suggestions with a view to maximize operational efficiency.
column11: Retail planning, Merchandise planning, OPEX, Budget preparation, Market intelligence, Retail management, Market research, Operations, Logistics, Retail business

column2: Role & responsibilities     Making production Time and action calendar - based on the process flow of an order merchants prepare time and action calendar and indicates who is responsible for the task. This helps merchant to execute an order whether it is on time or behind schedule. Merchants chase department who are running late.  Preparing Bill of material and handover it to sourcing department - Based on tech pack (technical sheet), merchant prepares material requirement sheet. In some cases, merchants develop and purchase few trim by themselves.  Execution of sourcing trims / accessories - merchants do follow up with supplier for the raw material. Preparing production file - Prepares production file with details documents, approvals, samples and swatches and comments on sample from buyer.  Conduct PP meeting with quality team and production team - merchants conduct pre-production (PP) meeting with production team and quality team. In this meeting merchants discuss style construction details, production plan, PCD and handover production file to the production team. One copy of production file is also made for quality team. Giving approval of printing, embroidery production and other subcontracting work. Execution of orders whether it is running on time. Coordination with buyer or buying house if any clarification is required during production. Giving clarification to production and quality team if required related to style workmanship/trims etc. Coordinating with buying house QA or 3rd Party QA for initial/mid and final inspection of shipment. Coordination with shipping and documentation department for forwarding the approved shipment. Keeping track of style status and updating the same to top management and buyer representatives. Preferred candidate profile   Candidates with min 5 Years of Work Exp as Production Merchandiser with an Export House.  Interested candidates can please send their CV at talent.acquisition@kazo.com
column11: Production, Merchandiser, Garments

Launch VMC program and Train and brief the VMC s across all stores with the latest guidelines and updates to ensure consistency across all stores. Keep up to date on what competitors are doing and provide feedback to Visual Merchandising Manager on any current and upcoming fashion trends across the Market. column1: Manager eCommerce Merchandise Planning - EM HUB
column2: This role is responsible for maximizing the sales, profitability, and brand equity of eCommerce through the management and execution of:                          Building, enhancing, and creating merchandise processes, reports and tools to support the Merchandise Planning team on Intake, Sales & Product Information as well as own country/cluster planning responsibilities.                              In-season article reporting and trading to ensure category and product performance meets expectations via a suite of KPIs and tools.                              Owning & developing the financial plan/guidance at a category & business segment level which includes being responsible for KPI s such as Net Sales, Standard Margin, Markdowns, Terminal Inventory Management & Inventory Turn.                            Key Responsibilities:                            Facilitate & provide documentation and information for monthly inventory meeting for inventory flow planning.                              Provide insights & updates through reporting suite to eCommerce (eCom) Emerging Markets Team and the Local Country/Cluster buying teams to build, deliver & interpret regular (Daily / weekly / monthly / quarterly / seasonal) category business & trading updates.                              Manage and monitor sales plans vs actuals to make recommendations and provide insights on article level performance to enact business decisions.                              Manage and work to improve the data requirements needed to build tools and reports to support the team and connect with analytics on request for advancement of merchandising processes and insights.                              Track, analyze, interpret and provide recommendations based on/for: market benchmarks and KPIs on productivity and sell thru, Improvement of Range Yield/Range Profitability, and other key merchandising KPIs.                              Forecast planning on business unit level, net sales, margin and ASP.                              Update category reports- To influence in-season & end of season markdown strategy.                              Build and manage merchandise plans with regards to product mix which includes Country, Season, Target customer, share of categories, gender mix, etc.                              Provide insight and suggestion for eCommerce channels in reconciliation with the Hub Merchandisers & Country/Cluster buying teams.                              Support the enhancement of all product planning systems and tools to suit world class buying practice across the Emerging Market territories.                              Drive eCommerce capacity planning processes for all Emerging Market countries.                              Provide insights and help the team provide actions insights while influencing the integrated business planning process.                              Work pro-actively, propose changes in processes to continually drive best in class experience for the adidas consumer.                              Other duties as requested by your manager.                            Key Relationships:                            eCom Team                              Supply Chain and Logistics                              Demand Planning/Finance Teams                              Marketing Activations/Campaign Operations                              Emerging Markets Analytics                              Consumer Experience Team                              Country eCom Buying Teams                            Knowledge, Skills and Abilities    :                          Structured, organized and process orientated.                              Ability to work effectively within a team environment and under pressure                              Strong analytical skills                              Attention to detail                              Fluent in English                              Advanced user of MS Office suite of products esp. Excel, Access, PPT                              Advanced knowledge of Retail Management Systems SAP AFS, SAP PGR, DVM, Microstrategy                              Dashboarding/Data Visualization experience a plus                            Requisite Education and Experience / Minimum Qualifications:                            University degree, ideally in business with sales and finance focus or equivalent professional experience                              6-8 years experience in merchandising or related functions (incl. buying, planning, distribution, budgeting)                              eCom experience a plus                              Functional awareness of Operations and Finance
column11: Supply chain, Merchandise planning, SAP, Reconciliation, Business planning, E-commerce, Analytics, ASP, Logistics, Capacity planning
